ygData.subject: RE: [cantera] Re: Problem with 64 bit installation
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi Sergey, Yes, indeed it appears to be another bug, which only happens on a 64 bit compile using the full python option, at least on my version of linux.

Hi Sergey,

  Yes, indeed it appears to be another bug, which only happens =
on a 64
bit compile using the full python option, at least on my version of=

linux. Apparently, the compiler is now insisting (or perhaps has always
in=
sisted but somehow we got away with it before) that all code being
linked i=
nto a shared library be compiled either all with or all without
the -fPIC o=
ption. The bug below is due to inconsistent compilations of
different parts=
 of cantera.

After fixing this issue manually, by adding -fPIC to various =
ext library
Makefiles, I was able to compile cantera.so_, make the entire c=
antera
package, and install it. It then passed the full test suite.

Note, =
however, that to do this for the full python option, I had to use
a 64 bit =
version of python, that I compiled myself, as the default
python shipped wi=
th my linux os is 32 bit, and therefore would not work
with 64 bit cantera =
shared libraries. The minimal python option doesn't
involve this complexity=
, because it doesn't use compiled C++ code.

I'll work on modifying the Mak=
efiles, to ensure that a uniform treatment
of the -fPIC option is insisted =
upon, later today.

Thanks again Sergey for pointing this bug out.

Best wi=
shes,
Harry
